{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3448121,"name":"Andrew Card","username":"AndrewCard","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/96bed5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-11-15T21:15:13.104Z","cooked":"

Hello FRC Teams,

The FRCDesign.org team has been working hard over these past few weeks on something new and exciting. As part of our ongoing efforts to improve FRC CAD resources, we are tackling the monumental task of refreshing the MKCad Library.

We’ve identified a few key areas of improvement we hope to address with the new library:

Key Areas for Improvement:

  • Organization of documents (decluttering, easier to search)
  • BOM, material, and appearance accuracy and consistency
  • Configurability of components/assemblies
  • Integration of simplified models and full-detail models into a single, configurable model
  • Persistence of mate connectors between configurations so mates don’t break
  • Feedback and model vetting process
  • Updated reporting system for missing parts

While we’ve carefully considered addressing common pain points in the library, we would love to gather feedback from the community on what else could be improved. However, we are limited in scope as to what we can change.

What Can Change:

  • Organization of documents
  • Model related changes

What Likely Can’t Change (At the moment):

  • Interface changes
  • Subfolder functionality
  • Advanced filtering functionality

The main reason we are focusing on frontend library improvements is that we currently lack the resources to address backend enhancements. While we plan to revisit this in the future, it is beyond this project’s scope. If anyone is experienced with Onshape app backend development and is willing to contribute, please contact us.

Transitioning from MKCad to FRCDesignLib:

We recognize the critical role MKCad plays in how teams use Onshape for robot design, so we are committed to thoroughly testing the new library before the original documents are phased out. To minimize the risk of any missing components during the transition, we plan to release a “complete” beta version of the new library as a separate app from MKCad sometime before kickoff for teams to try. This ensures that the legacy and new libraries are both available to teams during the season.

If all goes well, after the 2025 season, the MKCad app will be fully replaced with the new FRCDesignLib app (no “reinstall” will be required—the MKCad app will simply be updated to be the FRCDesignLib app). The old documents will remain accessible via link, so no previously inserted parts will be broken, but they will no longer receive updates and will no longer be accessible from the app.

Current Changes & Alpha Testing

For a preview of the improvements, check out the updated MKCad Electronics tabs! This includes Electronic Components, Motors, and Sensors. Since the format of the electronics tabs will remain the same, these tabs have already been replaced to offer an immediate improvement to the library.

We are also looking for alpha users to help test the new app. If you’re interested in gaining early access, contact @AndrewCard. Please note that everything is very subject to change, and there is a chance that parts and files may be deleted during the testing process.

If you have any feedback or suggestions, please leave it in this thread.

Thank you to everyone who has supported FRCDesign.org. We greatly appreciate the community’s feedback!

-The FRCDesign.org Team

FRCDesignLib will eventually totally replace MKCAD, once it is complete, and been given adequate testing.

This would be the place for feedback on more overarching things you would like to see changed with the app. Stuff we can keep in mind when developing the new library. For stuff like “X Part is missing” or “X Assembly is broken” should be in the normal MKCad thread. If you have further questions I can answer them aswell.

I am intending to use FRCDesign.org in the next few weeks for some educational sessions and will provide some feedback with how things go.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":56,"updated_at":"2024-12-19T21:32:20.457Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":615,"readers_count":614,"score":157.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":474973,"topic_slug":"frcdesignlib-feedback-needed","display_username":"Phil Szymanowski","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"http://FRCDesign.org","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FRCDesign.org","clicks":19}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10874,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 272 (Cyber Crusaders), FTC 23598 (Robotic Pretzles)"},"post_url":"/t/frcdesignlib-feedback-needed/474973/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3462037,"name":"Phil Szymanowski","username":"Cyberphil","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cyberphil/{size}/161083_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-20T19:10:19.671Z","cooked":"

Had our first session last night and got through stage 0 and began stage 1.

Here is a link to the playlist where we will be posting the videos. Session 1 should be in there now.

Really liked how FRCDesign.org is organized so far. The order of educational operations makes sense, focusing on navigating and setting up the software, then moving to basic sketch information, and then moving into simple features.

There was a lack of mention of comments and assigning tasks that is included in onshape. This is one of the best things about working as a team in the Onshape environment that should be given a bit more focus in my opinion.

More could be said about when and why to use construction geometry. Similarly with constraints. I often find both of these things are where a lot of people get hung up and don’t understand how they work, or when to add what constraints. This should be included in the onshape training materials, but some more focus on it here certainly wouldn’t hurt.

I didn’t live perform the exercises but moreso tasked the students with doing them in their own time to pickup the skills. I also started off with my layout sketch for the drive train as a derived sketch in the drive train model just because that’s how I like to model things.

Overall, this feels like the best CAD educational resource for FRC design I have personally used. Awesome work to the entire team!

Hello CD,

We believe the library has enough content to do a closed beta for the 2025 season!

If you (or your students) want access to the new library for the 2025 season please fill out this form. with your Onshape account email. Once I add you the app will be visible in the Onshape app store!

While we did not meet our original goal of having every part in the library before kickoff (turns out frc has alot of parts), we are still happy with where the library is currently at. We believe it has enough new tools to still be a valuable resource during the season.

Most Complete Tabs:
Bearings
Electronics (This is the same as current mkcad)
Fasteners
Extrusions
Gears
Sprockets

Note: Most of the content in unfinished tabs is from WCP, we are working through each vendor fully for these items to simplify our process. The complete library will have every relevant part from every vendor.

Bonus Items!
Simplified MAXPlanetary complete with Ratio Labels! (Gearbox Tab)

Screenshot 2025-01-03 at 12.27.14 PM465×742 46.2 KB

Configurable Roller! (Wheels Tab)

Screenshot 2025-01-03 at 10.12.01 PM977×530 84.3 KB

2025","clicks":5},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/mkcad-2024-post-season-feedback-and-requests/465041/116","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"MKCAD - 2024 Post-season Feedback and Requests","clicks":2},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/wcp-2024-25-product-release-updates/471152/710","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"WCP 2024-25 | Product Release & Updates","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":31}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60721,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6657 Mentor | FRCDesign.org"},"post_url":"/t/frcdesignlib-feedback-needed/474973/10","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":30},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":31,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3468684,"name":"Dominick Ferone","username":"Dominick_Ferone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dominick_ferone/{size}/236622_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-04T17:17:56.942Z","cooked":"
AndrewCard:

I added the App, where would it show up? Is it inside the existing MKCad app, or a new button?
